title: The Design of Everyday Things
author: Don Norman
description: This classic book explores the importance of intuitive design in everyday objects, and how poor design can lead to user errors.

title: Don't Make Me Think
author: Steve Krug
description: A common sense approach to web usability, this book provides insights on how to create a user-friendly interface.

title: About Face: The Essentials of Interaction Design
author: Alan Cooper
description: This book is a comprehensive guide to creating effective interfaces, touching on new devices and mobile design.

title: Lean UX: Applying Lean Principles to Improve User Experience
author: Jeff Gothelf with Josh Seiden
description: Lean UX shows you how to make user experience design a team approach and streamline processes.

title: 100 Things Every Designer Needs to Know About People
author: Susan Weinschenk
description: Combining real science and research with practical examples, this book delivers a guide on how to understand people's behavior.

title: Hooked: How to Build Habit-Forming Products
author: Nir Eyal
description: This book provides a guide on building products that capture users' attention and create habits.

title: The Elements of User Experience: User-Centered Design for the Web and Beyond
author: Jesse James Garrett
description: Jesse James Garrett shares an approach for creating a positive user experience from start to finish.

title: User Experience Team of One
author: Leah Buley
description: This book outlines approaches for doing great UX work with limited resources.

title: Information Architecture for the World Wide Web
author: Louis Rosenfeld & Peter Morville
description: Designing large-scale web sites, this book introduces the principles of information architecture.

title: Sprint: How to Solve Big Problems and Test New Ideas in Just Five Days
author: Jake Knapp
description: From three partners at Google Ventures, a unique five-day process for solving tough problems.

title: Measuring the User Experience
author: Thomas Tullis & William Albert
description: This book provides the first single source of practical information to enable usability professionals and product developers to measure the usability of any product.

title: Designing with the Mind in Mind
author: Jeff Johnson
description: A guide to understanding the principles of human perception and how they influence user interface design.
